(Experimental) Generate a shareable ID for an integration installed in a bot. This ID is meant to identify the crossover of a bot and an integration version, just like the webhook ID, but in a human-readable format. It is used for the integrations channel sandbox feature.

delete.description: (Experimental) Delete a shareable ID for an integration installed in a bot. This ID is meant to identify the crossover of a bot and an integration version, just like the webhook ID, but in a human-readable format. It is used for the integrations channel sandbox feature.

get.description: (Experimental) Get an existing shareable ID for an integration installed in a bot. This ID is meant to identify the crossover of a bot and an integration version, just like the webhook ID, but in a human-readable format. It is used for the integrations channel sandbox feature.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Bot](#schema_bot) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [Bot](#schema_bot) in ISO 8601 format

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Integration](#schema_integration) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [Integration](#schema_integration) in ISO 8601 format

title.description: Title of the integration. This is the name that will be displayed in the UI

description.description: Description of the integration. This is the description that will be displayed in the UI

iconUrl.description: URL of the icon of the integration. This is the icon that will be displayed in the UI

public.description: Indicates if the integration is public. Public integrations are available to all and cannot be updated without creating a new version.

verificationStatus.description: Status of the integration version verification

integrations.description: A mapping of integrations to their configuration

additionalProperties.description: Definition of a tag that can be provided on the object
Definition of a tag that can be provided on the object
Definition of a tag that can be provided on the object

schema.description: Schema of the [State](#schema_state) in the `JSON schema` format. This `JSON schema` is going to be used for validating the state data.

expiry.description: Expiry of the [State](#schema_state) in milliseconds. The state will expire if it is idle for the configured value. By default, a state doesn't expire.

states.description: A mapping of states to their definition

schema.description: Schema of the configuration in the `JSON schema` format. The configuration data is validated against this `JSON schema`.

failedAttempts.description: The number of times the recurring event failed to run. This counter resets once the recurring event runs successfully.

lastFailureReason.description: The reason why the recurring event failed to run in the last attempt.

events.description: Events that the bot is currently subscribed on (ex: "slack:reactionAdded"). If null, the bot is subscribed to all events.

deployedAt.description: Last deployment date of the [Bot](#schema_bot) in the ISO 8601 format

dev.description: Indicates if the [Bot](#schema_bot) is a development bot; Development bots run locally and can install dev integrations

createdBy.description: ID of the user that created the bot

alwaysAlive.description: Indicates if the [Bot](#schema_bot) should be in always alive mode

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Integration](#schema_integration) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [Integration](#schema_integration) in ISO 8601 format

fallbackHandlerScript.description: VRL Script of the [Integration](#schema_integration) to handle incoming requests for a request that doesn't have an identifier

extractScript.description: VRL Script of the [Integration](#schema_integration) to extract the identifier from an incoming webhook often use for OAuth

identifierExtractScript.description: VRL Script of the [Integration](#schema_integration) to extract the identifier from an incoming webhook used specifically for the sandbox

messageExtractScript.description: VRL Script of the [Integration](#schema_integration) to extract the message from an incoming webhook used specifically for the sandbox

Creation date of the [User](#schema_user) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [User](#schema_user) in ISO 8601 format

tags.description: Set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) that you can attach to a [User](#schema_user). The set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) available on a [User](#schema_user) is restricted by the list of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) defined previously by the [Bot](#schema_bot). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

User.description: The user object represents someone interacting with the bot within a specific integration. The same person interacting with a bot in slack and messenger will be represented with two different users.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) in ISO 8601 format

channel.description: Name of the channel where the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is happening

integration.description: Name of the integration that created the [Conversation](#schema_conversation)

tags.description: Set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) that you can attach to a [Conversation](#schema_conversation). The set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) available on a [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is restricted by the list of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) defined previously by the [Bot](#schema_bot). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

Conversation.description: The [Conversation](#schema_conversation) object represents an exchange of messages between one or more users. A [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is always linked to an integration's channels. For example, a Slack channel represents a conversation.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Event](#schema_event) in ISO 8601 format

payload.description: Payload is the content of the event defined by the integration installed on your bot or one of the default events created by our api.

conversationId.description: ID of the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) to link the event to.

userId.description: ID of the [User](#schema_user) to link the event to.

messageId.description: ID of the [Message](#schema_message) to link the event to.

failureReason.description: Reason why the event failed to be processed

Event.description: The event object represents an action or an occurrence.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Message](#schema_message) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Update date of the [Message](#schema_message) in ISO 8601 format

type.description: Type of the [Message](#schema_message) represents the resource type that the message is related to

payload.description: Payload is the content type of the message. Accepted payload options: Text, Image, Choice, Dropdown, Card, Carousel, File, Audio, Video, Location

tags.description: Set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) that you can attach to a [Conversation](#schema_conversation). The set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) available on a [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is restricted by the list of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) defined previously by the [Bot](#schema_bot). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

Message.description: The Message object represents a message in a [Conversation](#schema_conversation) for a specific [User](#schema_user).

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [State](#schema_state) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [State](#schema_state) in ISO 8601 format

name.description: Name of the [State](#schema_state) which is declared inside the bot definition

type.description: Type of the [State](#schema_state) represents the resource type (`conversation`, `user`, `bot`, `task`, `integration`, or `workflow`) that the state is related to

payload.description: Payload is the content of the state defined by your bot.

State.description: The state object represents the current payload. A state is always linked to either a bot, a conversation, or a user.

description.description: All the notes related to the execution of the current task

parentTaskId.description: Parent task id is the parent task that created this task

conversationId.description: Conversation id related to this task

userId.description: Specific user related to this task

timeoutAt.description: The timeout date where the task should be failed in the ISO 8601 format

createdAt.description: Creation date of the task in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the task in ISO 8601 format

failureReason.description: If the task fails this is the reason behind it

tags.description: Set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) that you can attach to a [Task](#schema_task). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

parentWorkflowId.description: Parent [Workflow](#schema_workflow) id is the parent [Workflow](#schema_workflow) that created this [Workflow](#schema_workflow)

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Workflow](#schema_workflow) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [Workflow](#schema_workflow) in ISO 8601 format

completedAt.description: The date when the [Workflow](#schema_workflow) completed in ISO 8601 format

failureReason.description: If the [Workflow](#schema_workflow) fails this is the reason behind it

timeoutAt.description: The timeout date when the [Workflow](#schema_workflow) will fail in the ISO 8601 format

tags.description: Set of [Tags](/docs/developers/concepts/tags) that you can attach to a [Workflow](#schema_workflow). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

name.description: Required. This name is used to identify your table.

factor.description: The 'factor' multiplies the row's data storage limit by 4KB and its quota count, but can only be set at table creation and not modified later. For instance, a factor of 2 increases storage to 8KB but counts as 2 rows in your quota. The default factor is 1.

frozen.description: A table designated as "frozen" is immutable in terms of its name and schema structure; modifications to its schema or a renaming operation are not permitted. The only action that can be taken on such a table is deletion. The schema established at the time of creation is locked in as the final structure. To implement any changes, the table must be duplicated with the desired alterations.

pattern.description: String properties must match this pattern

enum.description: String properties must be one of these values

items.description: Defines the shape of items in an array

searchable.description: Indicates if the column is vectorized and searchable.

hidden.description: Indicates if the field is hidden in the UI

order.description: Order of the column in the UI

width.description: Width of the column in the UI

code.description: Code to execute when action is "code"

model.description: Model to use when action is "ai"

workflowId.description: ID of Workflow to execute when action is "workflow"

typings.description: TypeScript typings for the column. Recommended if the type is "object", ex: "\{ foo: string; bar: number \}"

properties.description: List of keys/columns in the table.

additionalProperties.description: Additional properties can be provided, but they will be ignored if no column matches.

tags.description: Optional tags to help organize your tables. These should be passed here as an object representing key/value pairs.

isComputeEnabled.description: Indicates if the table is enabled for computation.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of table creation.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last table update.

name.description: Name of the column, must be within length limits.

description.description: Optional descriptive text about the column.

searchable.description: Indicates if the column is vectorized and searchable.

type.description: Specifies the data type of the column. Use "object" for complex data structures.

typings.description: TypeScript typings for the column. Recommended if the type is "object", ex: "\{ foo: string; bar: number \}"

code.description: Code to execute when action is "code"

model.description: Model to use when action is "ai"

workflowId.description: ID of Workflow to execute when action is "workflow"

createdAt.description: Timestamp of row creation.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last row update.

stale.description: [Read-only] List of stale values that are waiting to be recomputed.

similarity.description: Optional numeric value indicating similarity, when using findTableRows.

botId.description: The ID of the bot the file belongs to

key.description: Unique key for the file. Must be unique across the bot (and the integration, when applicable).

url.description:
URL to retrieve the file content. This URL will be ready to use once the file is uploaded.

If the file has a `public_content` policy, this will contain the permanent public URL to retrieve the file; otherwise, this will contain a temporary pre-signed URL to download the file which should be used shortly after retrieving and should not be stored long-term as the URL will expire after a short timeframe.

size.description: File size in bytes. Non-null if file upload status is "COMPLETE".

contentType.description: MIME type of the file's content

tags.description: The tags of the file as an object of key/value pairs

metadata.description: Metadata of the file as an object of key/value pairs. The values can be of any type.

createdAt.description: File creation timestamp in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: File last update timestamp in ISO 8601 format

accessPolicies.description: Access policies configured for the file.

index.description: Whether the file was requested to be indexed for search or not.

status.description:
Status of the file. If the status is `upload_pending`, the file content has not been uploaded yet. The status will be set to `upload_completed` once the file content has been uploaded successfully.

If the upload failed for any reason (e.g. exceeding the storage quota or the maximum file size limit) the status will be set to `upload_failed` and the reason for the failure will be available in the `failedStatusReason` field of the file.

However, if the file has been uploaded and the `index` attribute was set to `true` on the file, the status will immediately transition to the `indexing_pending` status (the `upload_completed` status step will be skipped).

Once the indexing is completed and the file is ready to be used for searching its status will be set to `indexing_completed`. If the indexing failed the status will be set to `indexing_failed` and the reason for the failure will be available in the `failedStatusReason` field.

failedStatusReason.description: If the file status is `upload_failed` or `indexing_failed` this will contain the reason of the failure.

expiresAt.description: File expiry timestamp in ISO 8601 format

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Account](#schema_account) in ISO 8601 format
Creation date of the [Account](#schema_account) in ISO 8601 format

value.description: The PAT value. This will only be returned here when created and cannot be retrieved later.

secrets.description: Secrets are integration-wide values available in the code via environment variables formatted with a SECRET_ prefix followed by your secret name. A secret name must respect SCREAMING_SNAKE casing.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Bot](#schema_bot) in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [Bot](#schema_bot) in ISO 8601 format

nextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results, passed as a query string parameter (value should be URL-encoded) to this API endpoint.

startDateTimeUtc.description: ISO 8601 date string of the beginning (inclusive) of the period

endDateTimeUtc.description: ISO 8601 date string of the end (exclusive) of the period

latency.description: The time it took for the LLM to complete its response. Values are expressed in milliseconds

tokensPerSecond.description: LLM response generation speed expressed in output tokens per second.

cost.description: Values are expressed in U.S. dollars

nextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results, passed as a query string parameter (value should be URL-encoded) to this API endpoint.

date.description: Date on which the invoice was generated.

amount.description: Total amount to pay of the invoice.

dueDate.description: Date on which the invoice is due.

paymentAttemptCount.description: Number of times payment has been unsuccessfully attempted on the invoice.

nextPaymentAttemptDate.description: Date on which the next payment attempt will be made.

pdfUrl.description: URL to download the PDF file of the invoice.

total.description: Total amount to pay of the invoice.

totalInCents.description: Total amount to pay (in cents) of the line item.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.

pricePerUnitInCents.description: Price per unit (in cents) of the line item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the subscription, if the line item is a subscription or a proration.

periodStart.description: Start date of the line item period.

periodEnd.description: End date of the line item period.

lineItems.description: List of items included in the invoice.

chargedInvoices.description: Invoices that were successfully charged by this request.

failedInvoices.description: Invoices that failed to be charged by this request.

period.description: Period of the quota that it is applied to

value.description: Value of the quota that is used

type.description: Usage type that can be used

value.description: Value of the quota that is used

type.description: Usage type that can be used

value.description: The IAK value. This will only be returned here when created and cannot be retrieved later.

validateIntegrationUpdateResponse.description: Validation succeeded: the integration can be updated using the same parameters

actions.description: Action names that matched the search term

matchedOn.description: Metadata about which fields matched the search criteria

schema.description: Schema of the [State](#schema_state) in the `JSON schema` format. This `JSON schema` is going to be used for validating the state data.

expiry.description: Expiry of the [State](#schema_state) in milliseconds. The state will expire if it is idle for the configured value. By default, a state doesn't expire.

states.description: A mapping of states to their definition

events.description: Events that the bot is currently subscribed on (ex: "slack:reactionAdded"). If null, the bot is subscribed to all events.
